```{r}
library(shiny)
library(leaflet)
library(readr)
library(dplyr)
library(sf)
library(rnaturalearth)
library(htmltools)
```


```{r}
# Load COVID data
data_cleaned <- read_csv("data_cleaned.csv")

# Load country centroids using ISO codes
world <- ne_countries(scale = "medium", returnclass = "sf") %>%
  mutate(centroid = st_centroid(geometry)) %>%
  mutate(
    longitude = st_coordinates(centroid)[, 1],
    latitude = st_coordinates(centroid)[, 2]
  ) %>%
  select(iso_a3, longitude, latitude)

# Join with your data
covid_with_coords <- data_cleaned %>%
  left_join(world, by = c("iso_code" = "iso_a3")) %>%
  filter(!is.na(latitude), !is.na(longitude))

# UI
ui <- fluidPage(
  tags$style(HTML("
    #date_ui {
      position: absolute;
      top: 10px;
      right: 20px;
      z-index: 1000;
      background-color: white;
      padding: 10px;
      border-radius: 10px;
      box-shadow: 0px 0px 10px rgba(0,0,0,0.2);
    }
  ")),

  leafletOutput("map", height = "100vh"),

  absolutePanel(id = "date_ui", fixed = TRUE, draggable = FALSE,
    sliderInput("date", "Select Date:",
                min = as.Date(min(covid_with_coords$date, na.rm = TRUE)),
                max = as.Date(max(covid_with_coords$date, na.rm = TRUE)),
                value = as.Date("2020-03-01"),
                timeFormat = "%Y-%m-%d",
                animate = animationOptions(interval = 1000, loop = FALSE))
  )
)

# Server
server <- function(input, output, session) {
  filtered_data <- reactive({
    covid_with_coords %>%
      filter(date == input$date)
  })

  output$map <- renderLeaflet({
    leaflet() %>%
      addTiles() %>%
      setView(lng = 0, lat = 20, zoom = 2)
  })

  observe({
    leafletProxy("map") %>%
      clearShapes() %>%
      clearMarkers() %>%
      addCircleMarkers(
        data = filtered_data(),
        lng = ~longitude,
        lat = ~latitude,
        radius = ~pmin(sqrt(total_cases) / 100, 30),
        color = "red",
        stroke = FALSE,
        fillOpacity = 0.7,
        popup = ~paste0(
          "<b>", location, "</b><br>",
          "Date: ", date, "<br>",
          "Cases: ", formatC(total_cases, format = "d", big.mark = ","), "<br>",
          "Deaths: ", formatC(total_deaths, format = "d", big.mark = ",")
        ) %>% lapply(HTML)
      )
  })
}

# Run App
shinyApp(ui, server)
```

```{r}
library(shiny)
library(leaflet)
library(dplyr)

ui <- fluidPage(
  tags$style(HTML("
    .absolute-panel {
      background-color: rgba(255,255,255,0.8);
      padding: 10px;
      border-radius: 8px;
      box-shadow: 0 0 5px rgba(0,0,0,0.3);
    }
  ")),

  leafletOutput("map", width = "100%", height = "100vh"),

  absolutePanel(
    top = 20, right = 20, width = 300, class = "absolute-panel",
    sliderInput("date", "Select Date:", 
                min = as.Date("2020-01-01"), 
                max = as.Date("2023-12-31"), 
                value = as.Date("2020-01-01"),
                timeFormat = "%b %Y",
                animate = animationOptions(interval = 1500, loop = TRUE))
  )
)

server <- function(input, output, session) {
  filtered_data <- reactive({
    shiny_data %>% filter(date == input$date)
  })

  output$map <- renderLeaflet({
    leaflet() %>%
      addTiles() %>%
      setView(0, 20, zoom = 2)
  })

  observe({
    leafletProxy("map") %>%
      clearMarkers() %>%
      addCircleMarkers(
        data = filtered_data(),
        lng = ~long, lat = ~lat,
        radius = ~log10(total_cases + 10) * 2,
        fillColor = "red",
        fillOpacity = 0.6,
        color = "white",
        weight = 0.5,
label = ~paste0(location, ": ", formatC(total_cases, big.mark = ","), " cases")
      )
  })
}

shinyApp(ui, server)
```

```{r}
# Install these if needed
install.packages("gganimate")
install.packages("transformr")

library(ggplot2)
library(gganimate)
library(dplyr)

# Example (replace with your cleaned dataset)
animated_plot <- data_cleaned %>%
  filter(!is.na(latitude), !is.na(longitude)) %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = long, y = lat, size = total_cases, color = total_cases)) +
  borders("world", colour = "gray90", fill = "gray95") +
  geom_point(alpha = 0.7) +
  scale_size_continuous(range = c(1, 10)) +
  scale_color_viridis_c() +
  theme_minimal() +
  labs(title = "COVID-19 Spread: {frame_time}", x = "", y = "") +
  transition_time(as.Date(date)) +
  ease_aes('linear')

# Save as GIF
anim_save("covid_spread.gif", animated_plot, width = 800, height = 500, duration = 15, fps = 10)
```

```{r}
ui <- fluidPage(
  tags$style(HTML("
    .absolute-panel {
      background-color: rgba(255,255,255,0.8);
      padding: 10px;
      border-radius: 8px;
      box-shadow: 0 0 5px rgba(0,0,0,0.3);
    }
  ")),

  leafletOutput("map", width = "100%", height = "100vh"),

  absolutePanel(
    top = 20, right = 20, width = 300, class = "absolute-panel",
    sliderInput("date", "Select Date:", 
                min = as.Date("2020-01-01"), 
                max = as.Date("2023-12-31"), 
                value = as.Date("2020-01-01"),
                timeFormat = "%b %Y",
                animate = animationOptions(interval = 1500, loop = TRUE))
  )
)

server <- function(input, output, session) {

  # Data with actual cases
  filtered_data <- reactive({
    shiny_data %>% filter(date == input$date & total_cases > 0)
  })

  # Data with zero total cases
  no_case_data <- reactive({
    shiny_data %>% filter(date == input$date & total_cases == 0)
  })

  output$map <- renderLeaflet({
    leaflet() %>%
      addTiles() %>%
      setView(0, 20, zoom = 2)
  })

  observe({
    leafletProxy("map") %>%
      clearMarkers() %>%

      # ðŸ”´ Add markers for countries with reported cases
      addCircleMarkers(
        data = filtered_data(),
        lng = ~long, lat = ~lat,
        radius = ~log10(total_cases + 10) * 2,
        fillColor = "red",
        fillOpacity = 0.6,
        color = "white",
        weight = 0.5,
        label = ~paste0(location, ": ", formatC(total_cases, big.mark = ","), " cases")
      ) %>%

      # âšª Add markers for countries with *no* cases
      addCircleMarkers(
        data = no_case_data(),
        lng = ~long, lat = ~lat,
        radius = 3,
        fillColor = "gray",
        fillOpacity = 0.5,
        color = "darkgray",
        weight = 0.5,
        label = ~paste0(location, ": No reported cases")
      )
  })
}

shinyApp(ui, server)
```

```{r}
# Install if not already installed
install.packages("gganimate")
install.packages("transformr")
install.packages("viridis")

library(ggplot2)
library(gganimate)
library(dplyr)
library(viridis)

# Use shiny_data if that's the dataset with lat/long
# Make sure these columns exist: lat, long, total_cases, date

# Filter and animate
animated_plot <- shiny_data %>%
  filter(!is.na(lat), !is.na(long), !is.na(date), total_cases > 0) %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = long, y = lat, size = total_cases, color = total_cases)) +
  borders("world", colour = "gray90", fill = "gray95") +
  geom_point(alpha = 0.7) +
  scale_size_continuous(range = c(1, 10)) +
  scale_color_viridis_c(option = "plasma") +
  theme_minimal() +
  labs(title = "COVID-19 Spread Over Time: {frame_time}",
       x = NULL, y = NULL) +
  transition_time(as.Date(date)) +
  ease_aes('linear')

# Save the animation as a GIF
anim_save("covid_spread.gif", animation = animated_plot, width = 800, height = 500, duration = 15, fps = 10)
```
